intro: Erucaria erucarioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf erucaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its delicate appearance.
